summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the indictment of two federal correctional officers, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, for falsifying records related to inmate checks at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on the night Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide. It details their alleged failure to perform required counts and rounds, and their false certifications that concealed this failure.

events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide by hanging himself in his cell, unobserved. His body was discovered by correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas at approximately 6:30 a.m.

events.description: The indictment against correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas was unsealed, and they surrendered to authorities.

keyFacts: Correctional officers Tova Noel and Michael Thomas were indicted for falsifying records and conspiring to defraud the United States by failing to conduct mandated inmate checks at the MCC.
No correctional officer conducted any count or round of the Special Housing Unit from approximately 10:30 p.m. on August 9, 2019, until approximately 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide by hanging himself during this period of no observation, and his body was discovered by Noel and Thomas at around 6:30 a.m.
Noel and Thomas allegedly signed false certifications attesting to having conducted five separate inmate counts that they never performed.
Epstein had been placed in the SHU cell closest to the officers' desk as a safety precaution following a previous suicide attempt on July 23, 2019.
